title: Police searching for missing youth basketball coach in Florida
description: Police in Florida are looking for a missing man who friends say was last seen likely going out for a run three days ago.

title: We put dozens of trackers in plastic bags for recycling. Many were trashed.
description: ABC News tracked dozens of plastic bags placed in retailers' recycling bins as part of an investigation into the effectiveness of America’s recycling streams.

title: WATCH:  Little bird chases off bald eagle perched too close to nest
description: A little bird managed to chase off a bald eagle perched a bit too close to its nesting area.

title: 'Work requirements' emerge as flashpoint in debt ceiling, spending talks
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy's has called the issue a "red line," but several Democrats say it's a nonstarter.

title: Ron DeSantis will launch 2024 presidential bid during event with Elon Musk: Sources
description: Ron DeSantis will launch his 2024 presidential campaign during a social media event with Elon Musk on Wednesday night, multiple sources said

title: McCarthy tells House Republicans 'nowhere near a deal' on debt, spending
description: He also told ABC News "we can still finish this by June 1st."

title: Super Typhoon Mawar set to hit Guam as potentially 'catastrophic' storm
description: Super Typhoon Mawar could directly hit Guam with winds as strong as 160 mph. It is expected to strike around noon local time Wednesday.

title: Prince Harry loses legal challenge in police protection case
description: Harry lost police protection when he stepped down from his senior royal role.

title: The night Uvalde football brought relief to grieving community: Reporter's notebook
description: A mass shooting brought immense grief to Uvalde, Texas, but the community united for Uvalde High School's first football game after the tragedy.

title: Russia extends detention of US journalist Evan Gershkovich by 3 months
description: Russian news agencies are reporting that a court has extended the arrest of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich by three months

title: UPS strike looms in a world grown reliant on everything delivered all the time
description: The last time UPS workers walked of the job more than two decades ago, it crippled the shipping company

title: Man gets stuck waist-deep in Alaska mud flats, drowns as tide comes in
description: A man walking on tidal mud flats with friends in an Alaska estuary got stuck up to his waist in the quicksand-like silt and drowned as the tide came in before frantic rescuers could extract him

title: WATCH:  Little boy surprised by dad returning home from deployment
description: The Washington boy ran to hug his dad who was returning home from his last Navy deployment.

title: DHS  announces body-worn camera policy for all its agencies
description: Department of Homeland Security announces “level set” body-worn camera policy for all department agencies

title: First responder dad springs into action to save son from pool
description: The video is prompting a pool safety reminder for parents ahead of summer.

title: Max down on launch day, new HBO streaming service not working
description: The streaming service replaces its predecessor HBO Max.

title: Kentucky sheriff's deputy fatally shot during traffic stop
description: Officials say a Kentucky sheriff’s deputy was shot and killed during a traffic stop

title: UK economy to avoid recession but inflation still a worry, IMF says
description: The International Monetary Fund says the British economy will avoid falling into recession this year

title: 'Everybody is mad': Experts explain why the Bud Light boycott is working
description: Sales of Bud Light have declined for six consecutive weeks, data showed.

title: Climate change protesters carried out of Shell shareholders meeting
description: Climate change protesters have been dragged away by security guards at oil company Shell’s annual shareholder meeting in London after activists tried to storm the stage and caused major disruption at the event

title: Father, son sentenced for decadelong, $20 million lottery fraud scheme
description: A father and son from Massachusetts have both been sent to prison for running an elaborate lottery fraud scheme designed to enrich themselves and help prize winners avoid paying taxes on their windfall

title: Idaho college murders: 2 slain students' families reserve right to sue Moscow
description: The families of two of the victims in the University of Idaho killings have filed notice reserving their right to sue the city of Moscow, according to documents.

title: Truck strikes barrier near White House, driver charged
description: The driver of a rented box truck that collided with a security barrier near the White House on Monday was arrested and charged, law enforcement officials said.

title: Prince Harry’s effort to pay for British police protection fails in court
description: A London judge has ruled against Prince Harry in his efforts to pay for police protection when he visits Britain

title: Police in Portugal resume search for Madeleine McCann
description: Portuguese police aided by German and British officers have resumed their search for Madeleine McCann, the British child who disappeared in the country’s southern Algarve region 16 years ago

title: Good Samaritan helping ducks cross busy street killed by teenage driver: Police
description: A good Samaritan who stopped his car to help a family of ducks cross a road in California was struck and killed by a teenage driver, police say.

title: Family of Colorado man killed by police during mental health crisis gets $19 million
description: The parents of a 22-year-old Colorado man killed by a sheriff’s deputy while suffering a mental health crisis will get $19 million from state and local agencies and changes to how officers are trained under a settlement

title: ExxonMobil sued over clerk who locked door in Detroit gas station shooting
description: A man injured in a deadly Detroit gas station shooting has filed a lawsuit against ExxonMobil alleging a clerk locked customers in the station's store with the gunman.

title: WATCH:  Curious orangutan examines baby at Louisville Zoo
description: This orangutan at the Louisville Zoo in Kentucky wanted a closer look at one of its visitors, a 3-month-old human baby.

title: Startup founder Charlie Javice pleads not guilty to fraud over sale to JPMorgan
description: An entrepreneur accused of exaggerating the value of her college financial planning startup ahead of its sale to JPMorgan pleaded not guilty to federal fraud charges.
